Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.basic

Class LocalizableLoggerWrapper

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.basic.LocalizableLoggerWrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
LoggerFacade, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class LocalizableLoggerWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements LoggerFacade

This class is a localizable implementation of LoggerFacade interface. This class is used as a wrapper to any other LoggerFacade instance. It has a Localizer associated with it, and always tries to transalate all format strings in the messages with the localizer.

Since:
0.0.3
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
LastUpdate:
0.0.4

    • transaction

      public LoggerFacade transaction​(java.lang.String mark) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Description copied from interface: LoggerFacade

      Create transaction logger instance. Use this call in the try-with-resource statement! Any messages to transaction logger will not be send anywhere before transaction end. Real transferring will be initiated when LoggerFacade.close() method would be called. Calling LoggerFacade.rollback() method immediately before calling LoggerFacade.close() scratches all messages from the transaction logger. This functionality is designed especially for reducing logger output: successful ending of the transaction doesn't produce any messages, but fatal ending keeps detailed trace for the longer analysis:

      try(LoggerFacade logger = ...transaction("MyTransaction")) {
      . . .
         logger.message(...);
      . . .
         logger.rollback(); // scratch all logger content on successful ending
      }
       For performance reason, method LoggerFacade.transaction(String, Class) is more preferred to use.
      Specified by:
      transaction in interface LoggerFacade
      Parameters:
      mark - any string to mark transaction logger trace for identification purposes. Can't be null or empty
      Returns:
      new logger instance. It must be closed mandatory
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when mark string is null or empty

    • transaction

      public LoggerFacade transaction​(java.lang.String mark, java.lang.Class<?> root) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Description copied from interface: LoggerFacade

      Create transaction logger instance. Use this call in the try-with-resource statement! Any messages to transaction logger will not be send anywhere before transaction end. Real transferring will be initiated when LoggerFacade.close() method would be called. Calling LoggerFacade.rollback() method immediately before calling LoggerFacade.close() scratches all messages from the transaction logger. This functionality is designed especially for reducing logger output: successful ending of the transaction doesn't produce any messages, but fatal ending keeps detailed trace for the longer analysis:

      try(LoggerFacade logger = ...transaction("MyTransaction")) {
      . . .
         logger.message(...);
      . . .
         logger.rollback(); // scratch all logger content on successful ending
      }
      Specified by:
      transaction in interface LoggerFacade
      Parameters:
      mark - any string to mark transaction logger trace for identification purposes
      root - root class where transaction logger was created
      Returns:
      new logger instance. It must be closed mandatory
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when root class is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when mark string is null or empty

    • rollback

      public void rollback()
      Description copied from interface: LoggerFacade

      Rollback transaction trace. If the logger instance is not a transaction logger, this call has no effect. Use this method as the last call in the try-with-resource block body!

      Specified by:
      rollback in interface LoggerFacade
      See Also:
      LoggerFacade.transaction(String)

    • close

      public void close()
      Description copied from interface: LoggerFacade

      Close logger. If this logger is transaction logger and it has any trace, the trace will be sent to the log file. To avoid this, use LoggerFacade.rollback() call in the try-with-resource block body.

      Specified by:
      close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface java.io.Closeable
      Specified by:
      close in interface LoggerFacade
      See Also:
      LoggerFacade.transaction(String)
